news.title: Construction workers suffer from joint pains: Study
news.para: ​The thesis by Rutvik Purani claimed that out of 457 participants who were construction workers, 44% reported joint pain, respiratory and neurological issues. About 38% had multiple joint pain.

news.title: Court directs ED to file reply on Avantha Group promoter's bail plea by Oct 1
news.para: Thapar, 60, was arrested under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) on August 3, after the agency carried out raids against him and his linked businesses in Delhi and Mumbai.

news.title: DHFL Case: NCLAT to hear FD, NCD holders and Wadhawan's plea on Sept 29
news.para: In June, the Mumbai bench of the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) approved the resolution plan of Piramal Capital and Housing Finance Limited. However, the order was challenged by Wadhawan at the appellate tribunal.

news.title: Tamil Nadu RERA rejects plea of engineer assessing quality of TNHB flats
news.para: The recent order of the state’s real estate regulator comes amid complaints by homebuyers of various TNHB housing projects in the city raising concern over the quality of constructions.

news.title: Gurugram: Kendriya Vihar flat owners set to get refund of 'excess transfer fee'
news.para: In the seven years since 2011, the homebuyers had paid a one-time transfer fee of 1.5% of the prevailing circle rate. However, in 2018, the Haryana government capped the fee at Rs 10,000.

news.title: Taxing times in Secunderabad cantonment areas, claim property owners
news.para: The SCB’s revised tax plans for 2022 fiscal, which is likely to include a steep rise, is already giving sleepless nights to property owners. This year alone the SCB has collected about Rs 80 crore to Rs 100 crore in property taxes, an SCB official said.

news.title: Rajasthan government finalises rates to issue lease deeds
news.para: To procure the lease deeds of plots situated in old inhabited areas, the residents have to pay between Rs 10 and Rs 50. Similarly, the plots developed on the land of erstwhile royal families will be regularised after paying a fee between Rs 50 and Rs 150.

news.title: Land records, plans issued online without signature valid: Goa government
news.para: The revenue department, in a notification, said that copies or extracts of the computerised property record, map or plan issued online — without any signature — is valid.

news.title: Rental agreements on Rs 20 stamp paper cause revenue loss to Pune civic body
news.para: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) officials claimed that details pertaining to the contract status of these properties and their termination dates are not known, leading to legal complications.

news.title: East Delhi civic body's drive targets long-term property tax defaulters
news.para: It has served notices to over 35,000 taxpayers with outstanding tax since June 2021. EDMC issued 20,947 notices in Shahdara south and 14,493 in the north zone.

news.title: In just 10 years, 128 land scam cases in Goa
news.para: Of the 128 land scam cases registered in the state, 73 are reported in the jurisdiction of Mapusa and Porvorim police station. On an average 10 land scam cases are reported every year across the state.

news.title: Co-living gaining traction among young professionals
news.para: With high-class amenities, lower rentals and opportunities to socialise, community living is the new definition of home for the young

news.title: Hines aims to form at least three partnerships with local builders in FY22
news.para: ​Hines, a privately-owned global real estate investment firm, entered India in 2006 and has so far invested over USD 400 million equity for development of projects across major cities.

news.title: Noida: Wait continues for Sports City buyers
news.para: The projects had been planned across the city — sectors 78, 79, 101, 150 and 152. A total of 45 projects were supposed to come up, with a major chunk of the development work in sectors 79 and 150.

news.title: Kolkata: Drainage approval must for buildings sanction along EM Bypass
news.para: Though this rule will also be applicable for construction of housing projects in the city proper, the civic body has decided to keep a special vigil on areas off Bypass, including Nayabad, Mukundapur and Panchasayar, and other added areas such as Behala and Joka.
